Articles.Content: And what about physic-less parts ?
Pictures of contracted parts in mission control.

What about stock launch checklist for all necessary systems?

Like something that says in VAB:

"You have not added any energy sources to your Spacecraft, do you really want to launch poor rocket to its doom?"

or

"You forgot to add any RCS thrusters, though you have RCS fuel. AGAIN?"

> 
> There are already a bunch of 1st time screens telling beginners what to do first. I'm rather assuming some practical/quality of life change.

I know, but the other day I saw a twiter post of a well known youtuber who was strugling to make her first orbit, which makes me think that the current information wasn't still enought.

But yeah, I would preffer some kind of feature that would be useful to me.

Of course there must be a countdown! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Very speculative guess here but how about kerbal achievements viewable from the Astronaut complex.

No idea how long this would take to do but a) it wouldn't need balancing, so could be added at the last minute, ![B)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_cool.png) the underlying code has been in the game for a while if I remember rightly (I might not ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) ) and c) it would be a nod back to the earliest days of KSP where the game was basically an altitude contest - and having some kind of in-game 'high score table' would have been good.

Edit. Either that or the Launch Tower is back! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
My official guess (and hope) is that it's the ability to time warp while engines are burning (in a more stable fashion and higher rate than previously).

Hmm, something at the first start of play?

First time, load into map view.

Then, you are asked to pick KSC's position on Kerbin. There is a hint that a place along the equator is maybe not a bad idea.
How bout Terrain Scatters (WIP) no longer being WIP?
Well, think about it. "Missing for far too long" doesn't mean it was never there. I say they're bringing the Boulder back.

I hope (if) it's a countdown (you can disable it).

I know what it is!

If you fix your staging on the launchpad, it saves it in the craft file.
